2025-08-13.content:
**Looker 25.14** is expected to include the following changes, features, and fixes:

* Expected Looker (original) deployment start: **Monday, August 18, 2025**
* Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: **Thursday, August 28, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: **Monday, August 18, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) final deployment: **Monday, September 1, 2025**

summary.title: Looker 25.14 Release
summary.summary: Looker 25.14 Release

2025-08-13.content: For projects that are enabled for the [New LookML Runtime](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/reference/param-manifest-new-lookml-runtime), the [`synonyms` parameter](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/reference/param-field) is now supported. The `synonyms` parameter lets LookML developers provide additional context about their data that will help [Conversational Analytics](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-analytics) and other features to answer questions more accurately.

summary.title: New LookML Runtime Synonyms Support
summary.summary: Synonyms parameter now supported for LookML projects enabled for the New LookML Runtime.

2025-08-13.content: The [API Usage Hourly System Activity Explore](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/usage-reports-with-system-activity-explores#api_usage_hourly) is now available. This Explore provides a detailed, hourly summary of the volume and performance of API calls that are made to your Looker instance.

summary.title: New Looker API Usage Report
summary.summary: The API Usage Hourly System Activity Explore is now available.

2025-08-13.content: Denodo 9 databases are now supported.

summary.title: Denodo 9 Support
summary.summary: Denodo 9 databases are now supported.

2025-08-13.content: The Maria JDBC Driver has been updated to version 3.5.3.

summary.title: Maria JDBC Driver Update
summary.summary: Maria JDBC Driver updated to 3.5.3

2025-08-13.content: The Athena driver has been updated to version 2.2.1.

summary.title: Athena driver update
summary.summary: The Athena driver is updated to version 2.2.1.

2025-08-13.content: The Databricks JDBC driver has been upgraded to version 2.7.3.

summary.title: Databricks driver update
summary.summary: Databricks JDBC driver upgraded to 2.7.3.

2025-08-13.content: A new JavaScript event, [`dashboard:tile:merge`](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/embedded-javascript-events#dashboardtilemerge), has been added.

summary.title: New JavaScript Event
summary.summary: A new JavaScript event, dashboard:tile:merge, has been added.

2025-08-13.content: Looker now displays a notice to instance admins if the instance license has been revoked. Admins will have 14 days to correct any problems before the instance will be shut down.

summary.title: Looker Instance License Revocation
summary.summary: Instance license revocation notice.

2025-08-13.content:
The following [Looker events](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/events) are now visible in the [System Activity Events Explore](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/usage-reports-with-system-activity-explores#event):

* `create_project`
* `delete_project`
* `update_project`
* `create_git_deploy_key`
* `delete_repository_credential`
* `update_repository_credential`

summary.title: New Project Events
summary.summary: New project events are available in the System Activity Events Explore.

2025-08-13.content: A new Customer Engineer Advanced Editor [default role](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-users-roles#customer_engineer_advanced_editor) has been added and can be used to [grant support access](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-general-support-access) to Google Cloud customer engineers.

summary.title: New Role Added
summary.summary: A new role, Customer Engineer Advanced Editor, is available to grant support access to Google Cloud customer engineers.

2025-08-13.content: The [Query Concurrency System Activity Explore](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/usage-reports-with-system-activity-explores#query_concurrency) is now available. This Explore can help you identify periods of high load and investigate performance bottlenecks that are related to database connection limits. **Note:** This feature was included in the Looker 25.12 release notes but its launch was delayed.

summary.title: Query Concurrency System Activity Explore Now Available
summary.summary: Identify high load periods and investigate performance bottlenecks related to database connection limits.

2025-08-13.content: New visualizations have been added to the [Database Performance dashboard](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/system-activity-dashboards#database_performance) and the [Instance Performance dashboard](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/system-activity-dashboards#instance_performance) in System Activity.

summary.title: New visualizations in System Activity
summary.summary: New visualizations are now available in the System Activity dashboards.

2025-08-13.content:
Looker 25.14 contains the following accessibility improvements:

* ARIA labels have been added to iframes that contain custom visualizations.
* ARIA labels have been added to legends on visualizations.
* ARIA labels have been added to modals.
* ARIA labels have been added to the Looker page header and logo.
* ARIA labels have been added to untitled dashboard tiles.
* Keyboard focus has been improved on modals.
* Text contrast has been increased on banners.
* Dashboard filters stay in focus while users are typing.
* Users can use the Explore from here link in a drill menu by using the keyboard.
* Users can interact with Single Value visualizations by using the keyboard.
* PDF rendering progress messages have been updated to better integrate with screen readers.

summary.title: Looker 25.14 release notes
summary.summary: Looker 25.14: Accessibility Improvements

2025-08-13.content: The LookML validation spinner now correctly stops if there is an error with the server's validation process.

summary.title: LookML Validation Fix
summary.summary: LookML validation spinner stops on server error.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where a route that wasn't intended for embedding was allowed to be embedded. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: Route Embedding
summary.summary: Route embedding fixed.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where "Create view from table" would fail if it was initiated from a LookML subfolder. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: "Create view from table" issue in LookML subfolders
summary.summary: The "Create view from table" feature now works correctly, even when initiated from a LookML subfolder.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where color palettes with Japanese labels could not be added or removed. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: Color Palette Issue
summary.summary: Japanese labels for color palettes fixed.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where getting LookML for dashboards wouldn't preserve all query filters even if they overlapped with dashboard-level filters. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: LookML dashboard filters
summary.summary: LookML dashboards now preserve all query filters.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where `include` statements for empty folders that used single-slash syntax returned an unrecognized project reference error. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: Include statements for empty folders
summary.summary: `include` statements for empty folders with single-slash syntax now work correctly, resolving an unrecognized project reference error.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where multiple tooltips could be displayed at once. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: Multiple Tooltips Issue
summary.summary: Multiple tooltips displayed at once have been fixed.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where project names weren't fully sanitized. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed project name sanitization
summary.summary: Project names are now fully sanitized.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where projects that have not been deployed to production wouldn't appear in a user's list of available projects. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed project visibility
summary.summary: Projects not deployed to production now appear in the user's project list.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where removing fields from embedded dashboard tiles could become impossible. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Issue Fix
summary.summary: Fix for embedded dashboard tile field removal.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where resetting a project's git connection and attempting to use a bare repo would fail. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Git Connection Fix
summary.summary: Fixed an issue with bare repo git connections.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where sorting a pivoted column in the drill modal could sort all pivoted columns instead of just the selected one. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: Sorting Issue in Drill Modal
summary.summary: Sorting pivoted columns in drill modal now works correctly.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where special characters such as slashes, ampersands, and question marks were allowed in BigQuery and Spanner connection names. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: Special characters in connection names
summary.summary: Special characters are no longer allowed in BigQuery and Spanner connection names.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where the HTTP error codes for moving and copying dashboards and Looks could return 422 when they should return 404. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: HTTP error codes for dashboard and Look operations
summary.summary: HTTP error codes for moving and copying dashboards and Looks now return 404 as expected, instead of 422.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where the last accessed time for Looks that were saved to a dashboard as Looks wasn't updated when the dashboard was accessed. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Look Last Accessed Time Update
summary.summary: Looks that were saved to a dashboard were not updating their last accessed time. This has been fixed.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where the MoreVert button would not be disabled when no options were available in the menu. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: MoreVert Button Behavior
summary.summary: The MoreVert button is now correctly disabled when no menu options are available.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where the new dashboard name wasn't preserved when a LookML dashboard was copied to a folder. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: Dashboard name preservation
summary.summary: Dashboard name preserved after copying LookML dashboard to a folder.

2025-08-13.content: An issue has been fixed where unfavoriting a dashboard or Look on a board would not persist. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed unfavoriting issue
summary.summary: Unfavoriting dashboards and Looks on a board now persists.

2025-07-25.content:
The [Code Interpreter in Conversational Analytics](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-analytics-code-interpreter) is available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages) for Looker (original) and Looker (Google Cloud core) instances. The Code Interpreter translates your natural language questions into Python code and executes that code to provide advanced analysis and visualizations. The Code Interpreter is disabled by default.

* Looker (original) instances must be on Looker 25.8 or later. Looker admins can manage enablement for the Code Interpreter on the [**Gemini in Looker** admin page](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-platform-gil#enable-and-disable-gil-original) of the Looker (original) instance.
* Looker (Google Cloud core) instances must be on Looker 25.10 or later. Looker admins can manage enablement for the Code Interpreter on the [**Gemini in Looker** admin page](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-admin-gemini#enable-ci-core) of the Looker (Google Cloud core) instance.

summary.title: New Code Interpreter Feature
summary.summary: Introducing the Code Interpreter for advanced analysis and visualizations, now in Preview for Looker.

2025-07-24.content:
**Looker 25.12** is expected to include the following changes, features, and fixes:

* Expected Looker (original) deployment start: **Monday, July 28, 2025**
* Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: **Thursday, August 7, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: **Monday, July 28, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) final deployment: **Wednesday, July 30, 2025**

summary.title: Looker 25.12 Release
summary.summary: Looker 25.12 Release

2025-07-24.content: Because of security concerns, text tiles no longer support the `form` and `input` Markdown elements.

summary.title: Breaking News
summary.summary: Text tiles no longer support form and input Markdown elements due to security concerns.

2025-07-24.content: The Oracle JDBC driver has been updated to version 19.25.

summary.title: Oracle JDBC Driver Update
summary.summary: Oracle JDBC driver updated.

2025-07-24.content: For faster response time for queries in BigQuery, Looker will execute BigQuery queries by using [`jobCreationMode=JOB_CREATION_OPTIONAL`](https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/rest/v2/jobs/query#jobcreationmode). If BigQuery can return immediate results, it will run the query without creating a job, so the record in the Looker query history will have a BigQuery query ID instead of a BigQuery job ID. See the [Understanding query performance metrics](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/query-performance-metrics#bigquery_bi_engine_metrics) documentation page for more information about the BigQuery BI Engine metrics.

summary.title: Faster BigQuery Queries in Looker
summary.summary: Looker now uses an improved method for running BigQuery queries, leading to faster response times.

2025-07-24.content: The [Query Concurrency System Activity Explore](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/usage-reports-with-system-activity-explores#query_concurrency) is now available. This Explore can help you identify periods of high load and investigate performance bottlenecks that are related to database connection limits. **Note:** This feature launch was delayed and is now available in Looker 25.14. This item was updated on August 13, 2025.

summary.title: New Feature: Query Concurrency
summary.summary: Query concurrency is now available to help identify load periods and investigate performance bottlenecks.

2025-07-24.content:
Looker 25.12 contains the following accessibility improvements:

* Improved contrast for exit buttons on dialogs
* Improved contrast for checkbox borders

summary.title: Looker 25.12 Accessibility Update

summary.title: Fixed: Pull Request Owner Display Issue
summary.summary: Pull requests now display the correct owner.

summary.summary: Permissions error fixed when exploring from dashboard tile.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where the row limit in an Explore could display a blank field when the row limit was set to 5,000. This feature now performs as expected.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where some users were unable to create or edit BigQuery OAuth connections. This feature now performs as expected.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where SQL Runner would display a blank page if a user changed the visualization type after pivoting on a dimension. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.summary: SQL Runner fixed blank page issue after visualization change.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where some queries to the internal database were unoptimized, affecting instance performance. This feature now performs as expected.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where fields could be sorted differently when a visualization was downloaded or scheduled as a PNG. This feature now performs as expected.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where the `all_connections` API call could ignore the `fields` parameter. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.summary: The `all_connections` API call now correctly handles the `fields` parameter.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where a map visualization would display drill links for fields that were hidden from the visualization. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.summary: Map visualization drill links fixed.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where some System Activity tables were missing the `element_id` field. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: System Activity Tables
summary.summary: System Activity tables missing element_id field fixed.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where subtotals could be incorrectly formatted in PDF downloads when an HTML parameter was defined on the field and the "Expand tables to show all rows" option was enabled. This feature now performs as expected.

2025-07-24.content: The Looker IDE now checks for subparameters in local and remote dependencies and displays a more informative error if the subparameters are missing. Local dependencies must be defined with a project subparameter, while remote dependencies require both a `url` subparameter and a `ref` subparameter.

summary.summary: IDE now checks for subparameters in local and remote dependencies. Local dependencies require a project subparameter, while remote dependencies need both url and ref subparameters for more informative error messages.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where editing a merged query in an embedded session would open in a new tab. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Bug Fix for Merged Query Editing
summary.summary: Editing a merged query in an embedded session now opens in a new tab as expected.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where Looker could generate duplicate SQL table references if a PDT referenced a table directly as well as through a join. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed duplicate SQL references in Looker
summary.summary: Looker no longer generates duplicate SQL table references when a PDT references a table directly as well as through a join.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where some PDT regeneration events were not tracked in System Activity. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed PDT regeneration tracking
summary.summary: PDT regeneration events were not tracked in System Activity.

2025-07-24.content: When an Explore is saved as a new dashboard, Looker will create advanced filter type dashboard filters, rather than drop-down type dashboard filters, for number type parameters.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where SAML authentication could fail for a Looker (Google Cloud core) instance. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: SAML authentication fixed
summary.summary: SAML authentication issue fixed.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where the Looker Marketplace toggle was not being displayed in Looker core instances for users who were granted Admin permissions with an IAM role. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Looker Marketplace Fix
summary.summary: Looker Marketplace toggle now displayed correctly for IAM admins.

2025-07-24.content: An issue has been fixed where installing multiple drivers for the same database type on a customer-hosted instance could cause Looker to display an error. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed driver installation issue
summary.summary: An issue with installing multiple drivers for the same database type on a customer-hosted instance has been fixed.

2025-06-30.content: The Fast Dev Mode Transition feature is out of Labs and is now generally available. The Fast Dev Mode Transition feature improves the performance of [Development Mode](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/dev-mode-prod-mode#development_mode) on your instance by loading LookML projects in read-only mode until a developer clicks the [Create Developer Copy](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/git-command-reference#create-developer-copy) button for the project. **Note:** This item was added on July 8, 2025.

summary.title: Fast Dev Mode Transition Now Generally Available
summary.summary: Fast Dev Mode Transition is now generally available, improving development mode performance by loading LookML projects in read-only mode until a developer creates a copy.

2025-06-30.content: The Fast Dev Mode Transition feature is now available for Looker (Google Cloud core). The Fast Dev Mode Transition feature improves the performance of [Development Mode](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/dev-mode-prod-mode#development_mode) on your instance by loading LookML projects in read-only mode until a developer clicks the [Create Developer Copy](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/git-command-reference#create-developer-copy) button for the project. **Note:** This item was added on July 8, 2025.

summary.title: New Fast Dev Mode Transition for Looker
summary.summary: Looker's Fast Dev Mode Transition is now available, improving instance performance by loading LookML projects in read-only mode until a developer initiates a copy. This enhancement applies to Looker (Google Cloud core).

2025-06-24.content:
The following feature is generally available for Looker reports:

* The Looker connector can now connect to a [private IP (private services access) only](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-networking-options#private_ip_connections) Looker (Google Cloud core) instance or to a [private IP (Private Service Connect)](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-networking-options#psc) Looker (Google Cloud core) instance [using the Looker instance ID](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-connect-to-private-ip-lsp-sil).

summary.title: Looker connector supports private IP connections
summary.summary: The Looker connector now supports connecting to Looker (Google Cloud core) instances using private IP addresses, including those with Private Service Connect.

2025-06-11.content:
**Looker 25.10** is expected to include the following changes, features, and fixes:

* Expected Looker (original) deployment start: **Tuesday, June 17, 2025**
* Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: **Thursday, June 26, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: **Monday, June 16, 2025**
* Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) final deployment: **Monday, June 30, 2025**

summary.title: Looker 25.10 Release Notes
summary.summary: Looker 25.10 release is scheduled for June 2025, with deployments for Looker (original) starting June 17th and Looker (Google Cloud core) starting June 16th. Final deployments and downloads will be available by June 26th for original and June 30th for Google Cloud core.

2025-06-11.content:
The [Embed SDK](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/embed-sdk-intro) has been upgraded to release 2.0.0. While the 2.0.0 API is backwards-compatible with Embed SDK 1.8.x, the underlying implementation has changed for some functionality. SDK 1.8.x exported a number of classes. SDK 2.0.0 replaces these classes with interfaces that are marked as deprecated (alternative interfaces are identified). We recommend that applications use the interfaces that have an 'I' prefix (the interfaces that have prefixes are identical to the interfaces that don't have them). Applications that are upgraded to SDK 2.0.0 should continue to work and behave as they did previously. To take advantage of the API improvements, some refactoring will be required. The following major changes are included in Embed SDK 2.0.0:

* Navigating between dashboards, Explores, and Looks no longer requires that an iframe be recreated. Instead, the `loadDashboard`, `loadLook`, `loadExplore`, and `loadUrl` methods can be used to navigate within the Looker iframe.
* `connect` now returns a unified connection rather than a connection that is related only to a dashboard, a Look, or an Explore. The unified connection allows embedding applications to detect a user navigating inside the iframe.
* Support for additional Looker embedded content has been added for Looker reports and query visualizations.

**Note:** This item was added on June 13, 2025.

summary.title: Embed SDK upgraded to 2.0.0
summary.summary: The Embed SDK has been upgraded to version 2.0.0. This new version is backward-compatible with 1.8.x but introduces changes to how classes are exported, recommending the use of interfaces instead. Key improvements include eliminating the need to recreate iframes for navigation, a unified connection object for better event detection, and expanded support for Looker reports and query visualizations. Some refactoring may be needed to leverage the new features.

2025-06-11.content: For period-over-period (PoP) measures, a new subparameter, [`value_to_date`](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/period-over-period#value_to_date), is available. When a PoP measure is defined with `value_to_date:yes`, Looker will calculate the amount of time in the current timeframe at the time that the query is run and apply that amount of time when it calculates the values for previous periods.

summary.title: New subparameter for period-over-period measures
summary.summary: Looker's period-over-period measures now support a `value_to_date` subparameter. This allows for more accurate calculations of previous periods by considering the current timeframe when the query is executed.

2025-06-11.content: The Firebolt JDBC driver has been updated to version 3.5.0.

summary.title: Firebolt JDBC driver updated to version 3.5.0
summary.summary: The Firebolt JDBC driver has been updated to version 3.5.0, offering improved performance and reliability for data connectivity.

2025-06-11.content: The Hive JDBC driver has been updated to version 4.0.1.

summary.title: Hive JDBC driver updated
summary.summary: The Hive JDBC driver has been updated to version 4.0.1.

2025-06-11.content: The MS SQL JDBC driver has been updated to version 12.10.0.

summary.title: MS SQL JDBC driver updated
summary.summary: The MS SQL JDBC driver has been updated to version 12.10.0.

2025-06-11.content: The Teradata JDBC driver has been updated to version 20.00.00.45.

summary.title: Teradata JDBC driver updated
summary.summary: The Teradata JDBC driver has been updated to version 20.00.00.45.

2025-06-11.content: The Vertica JDBC driver has been updated to version 24.2.0-1.

summary.title: Vertica JDBC Driver Update
summary.summary: The Vertica JDBC driver has been updated to version 24.2.0-1.

2025-06-11.content: The new Content Guardrails admin panel lets Looker admins limit both the ability for users to add or execute merged results queries on dashboards and the use of the dashboard auto-refresh option. Limiting merged results queries and dashboard auto-refreshes can reduce the number of queries that are sent to the database and improve dashboard performance. **Note:** This item was added on June 12, 2025.

summary.title: Control Merged Results and Auto-Refresh
summary.summary: Looker admins can now control user access to merged results queries and dashboard auto-refresh functionality. This feature helps reduce database load and enhance dashboard performance by limiting query execution.

2025-06-11.content: The Looker [Continuous Integration (CI)](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/continuous-integration) features let you run tests on your LookML project to deliver more reliable, efficient, and user-friendly data experiences. You can use the CI validators to catch issues with SQL, data test, content, and LookML before they hit production to verify your LookML and prevent query errors for your users. You can also configure the CI validators to run automatically when a pull request is submitted to your LookML repository. **Note:** This item was added on June 23, 2025.

summary.title: Looker CI Features
summary.summary: Looker's new Continuous Integration features enable automated testing of your LookML projects, catching SQL, data test, content, and LookML issues before they reach production. This ensures more reliable and user-friendly data experiences by preventing query errors.

2025-06-11.content:
This release contains the following accessibility improvements:

* Increased contrast ratio for graphic elements, including icon bullets
* Improved contrast for download links and unemphasized text to comply with Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) Level AA

summary.title: Accessibility Improvements
summary.summary: This release includes accessibility improvements such as increased contrast for graphic elements and links, ensuring compliance with WCAG Level AA standards.

2025-06-11.content: The Tile Actions kebab menu now includes the name of the dashboard tile in its `aria-label` value.

summary.title: Accessibility improvements for Tile Actions menu
summary.summary: The Tile Actions kebab menu's aria-label now includes the dashboard tile's name for improved accessibility.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where SDK API calls could return a 500 error if optional headers were not specified. The API calls now work as expected even if optional headers are not included.

summary.title: Fixed: SDK API call errors
summary.summary: SDK API calls now correctly handle missing optional headers, resolving the 500 error.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where the PDT Override Service Account field was not available for connections that use OAuth credentials. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: PDT Override Service Account Field Fixed
summary.summary: The PDT Override Service Account field is now available for connections using OAuth credentials, resolving a previous issue.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where the Manage Access dialog on a folder could load slowly if the Looker instance has a large number of groups. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Manage Access dialog performance improved
summary.summary: The Manage Access dialog for folders now loads quickly, even with a large number of groups in the Looker instance.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where, previously, testing a new OAuth connection before saving would run connection tests on an empty connection. OAuth settings must now be saved before running connection tests. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed: OAuth connection testing
summary.summary: Previously, testing a new OAuth connection before saving would run connection tests on an empty connection. OAuth settings must now be saved before running connection tests. This feature now performs as expected.

2025-06-11.content: The OAuth Tenant ID field will no longer appear in connections for which it is not relevant. The only connection type that supports this field is Trino.

summary.title: OAuth Tenant ID field updated
summary.summary: The OAuth Tenant ID field is now hidden for irrelevant connections. This field is only relevant for Trino connections.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where the API calls to run git connection tests would fail unless the user was in dev mode. These calls now work as expected whether the user is in production or development mode.

summary.title: Fixed git connection test API calls
summary.summary: API calls for git connection tests now function correctly in both production and development modes, resolving a previous issue where they only worked in dev mode.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where drill downs wouldn't be displayed for a field if the first field value had null values. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Drill down issue fixed
summary.summary: Drill downs now display correctly even if the first field value is null.

2025-06-11.content:
An issue has been fixed where assigning the user attribute
`looker_internal_email_domain_allowlist` on the SAML config page would return a 500 error. This user attribute is not designed to be assigned at the user level, so the option to assign it has been removed from the SAML config page.

summary.title: User attribute assignment fixed
summary.summary: The ability to assign the user attribute `looker_internal_email_domain_allowlist` on the SAML config page has been removed due to a bug that caused a 500 error. This attribute is not intended for user-level assignment.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where restarting the Looker instance during a folder sync could cause the instance to fail to start.

summary.title: Looker instance startup issue fixed
summary.summary: The Looker instance could fail to start after being restarted during a folder sync. This issue has now been resolved.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where selecting fields from the Session view in the System Activity User Explore could cause fanout. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed fanout issue in System Activity User Explore
summary.summary: The fanout issue when selecting fields from the Session view in the System Activity User Explore has been resolved. This feature now functions correctly.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where the `count` table calculation function could return incorrect values if its inputs included a list with null values. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed incorrect calculation in `count` table function
summary.summary: The `count` table calculation function now correctly handles lists with null values, returning accurate results.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where the drill menu did not properly translate some entries when the locale was set to Swedish (sv\_SE). This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Drill menu translation fixed for Swedish locale
summary.summary: The drill menu in the product now correctly translates all entries when the locale is set to Swedish.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where drilling on a query with subtotals could display incorrect values. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed incorrect values in queries with subtotals
summary.summary: Drilling on a query with subtotals now displays the correct values, resolving a previous issue.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where filtering on a custom dimension that references a `datetime` type field could return the following error message: `No matching signature`. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed issue with custom dimension filtering
summary.summary: Filtering on a custom dimension that references a datetime type field could return an error. This issue has now been resolved and the feature performs as expected.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where the LookML validator would return a 500 error if a LookML file contained a `sum_distinct` measure for a database that doesn't support `sum_distinct` measures. The LookML validator now returns a more descriptive error message.

summary.title: Fixed LookML validator error for sum_distinct measures
summary.summary: The LookML validator no longer returns a 500 error for LookML files with `sum_distinct` measures on unsupported databases. Instead, it provides a more informative error message, improving the developer experience.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where entering the value `12:00` in the Time field of an alert schedule dialog would input `00:00` instead.

summary.title: Time field input corrected
summary.summary: The Time field in alert schedules would incorrectly display 00:00 when 12:00 was entered. This issue has now been resolved.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where changes to PDT override settings would not be saved. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed issue with PDT override settings
summary.summary: PDT override settings are now saved correctly after an issue that prevented this has been resolved. The feature is functioning as expected.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where PDTs could fail to rebuild with the following error message: `undefined method trace_id_hex`. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed PDT rebuild issue
summary.summary: PDTs failing to rebuild due to an "undefined method trace_id_hex" error have been resolved. The feature now functions correctly.

2025-06-11.content: You can now [embed Looker reports](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/embed-reports) on Looker (original) instances when Looker reports and the Embed Looker reports Labs features are enabled for your instance. Looker reports are available in preview.

summary.title: Embedding Looker reports is now available
summary.summary: Looker reports are now available for embedding on Looker (original) instances with the relevant features enabled. This feature is currently in preview.

2025-06-11.content: An issue has been fixed where LDAP authentication could fail with the following error message: `no implicit conversion of Hash into String`. This feature now performs as expected.

summary.title: Fixed LDAP authentication issue
summary.summary: LDAP authentication no longer fails with a hash to string conversion error.

2025-06-11.content: The [Code Interpreter in Conversational Analytics](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/studio/conversational-analytics-code-interpreter) is now available in [Preview](https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages). The Code Interpreter translates your natural language questions into Python code and executes that code to provide advanced analysis and visualizations. The Code Interpreter is disabled by default. Admins of Looker (Google Cloud core) instances can manage enablement for the Code Interpreter on the [Gemini in Looker admin page](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-core-admin-gemini#enable-ci-core). **Note:** This item was added on June 23, 2025.

summary.title: New Code Interpreter Available for Conversational Analytics
summary.summary: A new code interpreter feature is available for conversational analytics, allowing users to translate natural language questions into Python code for advanced analysis and visualizations. This feature is disabled by default and can be managed by instance administrators.

2025-06-09.content:
Gemini in Looker will be enabled by default for Looker (original) instances that meet at least one of the following criteria:

* The Automated Gemini in Looker enablement and user management setting on the Settings page in the Looker Admin panel was previously enabled.
* The instance is updated to Looker 25.6 or later after June 9, 2025.

Instances that are hosted in the [EMEA region](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/looker-original-locations) and those that are enrolled in Looker's [Extended Support Release (ESR) program](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/standard-extended-support-release-program-overview) are exempt from automatic enablement.

Looker admins can still manage Gemini in Looker enablement manually on the [Gemini in Looker](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-platform-gil) page in the Admin panel.

summary.title: Gemini in Looker enablement update
summary.summary: Gemini in Looker will be automatically enabled by default for Looker (original) instances starting with version 25.6, provided they meet specific criteria or had the feature enabled previously. However, instances in the EMEA region or those in the ESR program are exempt from this automatic enablement. Admins retain manual control over the feature

2025-06-09.content:
When the [Automated Gemini in Looker enablement and user management](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-general-settings#gemini_default_enablement) setting is enabled, the Gemini Default Users group
is created automatically for instances that use an [open system configuration](https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/access-levels#open_and_closed_systems_of_access_to_folders). The Gemini Default Users group is populated automatically with all existing users and any new users who are added to the instance.

summary.title: Automated Gemini in Looker
summary.summary: A new feature is available for Looker, regarding the Automated Gemini enablement and user management. When the relevant setting is enabled, a Gemini Default Users group is automatically created and populated with all existing and new users for instances using an open system configuration.
